value.title: UK government sets out AI standards roadmap
value.excerpt: The UK’s Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation (CDEI) has published a roadmap for building an “assurance ecosystem” for artificial intelligence (AI).

value.title: AI Trends 2022: Spare Us The Hype, We Want Business Results
value.excerpt: The latest industry analyst predictions about artificial intelligence (AI) are out, and they’re certain to oust a ton of assumptions we’ve made to date.

value.title: How AI ethics falls short - preserving jobs is not enough
value.excerpt: AI ethics has been a hot topic for about five years, but are we getting to the fundamental issues? Here's why well-intentioned ideas for preventing AI job loss come up short.

value.title: Artificial intelligence carries a huge upside. But potential harms need to be managed
value.excerpt: The increasing use of artificial intelligence and machine learning in public decision making is raising critical issues around fairness and human rights.

value.title: For truly ethical AI, its research must be independent from big tech
value.excerpt: We must curb the power of Silicon Valley and protect those who speak up about the harms of AI

value.title: Ex-Google AI ethics expert Timnit Gebru to launch anti-bias research institute
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru is launching an artificial intelligence research institute after Google fired her for claiming the company's AI were unethical.

value.title: AI Weekly: Recognition of bias in AI continues to grow
value.excerpt: There's growing recognition that AI encodes biases. Efforts are underway to address these while recognizing the challenges.

value.title: Google ethical AI co-lead Timnit Gebru launches own research project

value.title: The Movement to Hold AI Accountable Gains More Steam
value.excerpt: A New York City law requires algorithms used in hiring to be “audited” for bias. It’s the first in the US—and part of a larger push toward regulation.

value.title: Big tech wants to compete with banks? Let them deal with AI ethics first
value.excerpt: As big tech moves into the world of finance, AI ethics will be one of its biggest challenges including bias and ensuring data privacy.

value.title: How much can we trust AI? How to build confidence before large-scale deployment
value.excerpt: Organizations must still build trust in AI before they deploy it throughout the organization. Here are some simple steps to make AI more dependable and ethical.

value.title: 4 AI trends for 2022: Neural networks, strategic ethics, better hiring and gastronomy
value.excerpt: In 2022, we can expect AI to expand its reach into robotic automation, better software for decision-making and a confrontation of the looming ethical issues, according to Sony experts.

value.title: Ethics Of AI: 193 Members Of UNESCO Adopt Recommendations
value.excerpt: In a historic global agreement, all 193 members of UNESCO adopt the recommendations on the ethics of AI document

value.title: Ex-Google AI ethics chief: Boost worker power to curb harmful AI
value.excerpt: Governments need to curb the power of tech companies and increase the power of workers in order to safeguard people from unsafe uses of artificial intelligence, Google's former AI ethics chief Timnit Gebru told a hearing at the European Parliament on Tuesday.

value.title: KATE THOMPSON DAVY: Unesco’s global standard on AI ethics provides smart blueprint for laws
value.excerpt: Rather, the good governance of AI was given a huge boost in the form of the first global standard on AI ethics. A Unesco project presented to the world by director-general Audrey Azoulay on November 25,

value.title: Trans-AI will propel Artificial General Intelligence to Superintelligence
value.excerpt: The critical issue is that Artificial Intelligence is weak and narrow, instead of being trans-disciplinary AI or true machine intelligence and learnin..

value.title: How to remove bias from AI models
value.excerpt: With AI making more real-world decisions everyday, reining in bias is more important than ever. As AI becomes more pervasive, AI-based discrimination is getting the attention of policymakers and corporate leaders but keeping it out of AI-models in the first place is harder than it sounds.

value.title: UNESCO launches global standard for AI ethics
value.excerpt: Standard aims to provide AI with a strong ethical basis that will not only protect but also promote human rights and human dignity.

value.title: Creepy Humanoid Robo-Artist Gives Public Performance Of Its Own AI-Generated Poetry
value.excerpt: Ai-Da creates artworks and writes poetry using a sophisticated language model, word data bank, and speech pattern analysis.

value.title: Want to develop ethical AI? Then we need more African voices
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) was once the stuff of science fiction. But it’s becoming widespread. It is used in mobile phone technology and motor vehicles. It powers tools for agriculture and healthcare.

value.title: AI Weekly: UN recommendations point to need for AI ethics guidelines
value.excerpt: The United Nations' new AI ethics regulations point to growing recognition of the need for AI ethics guidelines.

value.title: AI Ethics adopted by 193 countries, ML to decode Rembrandt's Painting, Detectron, and Tensorflow GNN
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) used to be thought of as an idealistic technology that can only exist in sci-fi movies. Contrasting to the belief, today the technology has become so mature in a short tenure that all major companies are using it to their advantage.

value.title: UN countries adopt first global agreement on AI ethics
value.excerpt: The United Nations Thursday adopted a historical text defining the common values and principles needed to ensure the healthy development of artificial intelligence. The agreement was adopted at the

value.title: 193 countries adopt 1st global agreement on Ethics of AI
value.excerpt: All member nations of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) adopted on Thursday a historical text that defines the common values and principles needed to ensure the healthy development of artificial intelligence (AI).

value.title: 193 countries adopt the first global agreement on the Ethics of Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is present in everyday life, from booking flights and applying for loans to steering driverless cars. It is also used in specialized fields such as cancer screening or to help create inclusive environments for the disabled.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Ethics Agreement adopted by 193 countries
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is present in everyday life, from booking flights and applying for loans to steering driverless cars. It is also used in specialized fields such as cancer screening or to help create inclusive environments for the disabled.

value.title: Our global agreement on AI could reduce bias and surveillance
value.excerpt: Nearly 200 countries have signed up to UNESCO's agreement on the ethics of artificial intelligence. This could help make the technology fairer for all, says Gabriela Ramos

value.title: When Reddit Is Your AI Language Instructor
value.excerpt: When it was asked about bringing a Polish friend, it replied, “Yes, but you can’t bring your own booze.” Mrksic, who is Serbian, admits that the system appeared to think people from Serbia were immature.

value.title: University of Helsinki: Massive open online course Ethics of AI translated in Finnish and Swedish
value.excerpt: The Finnish and Swedish translations for the University of Helsinki’s online course Ethics of AI will open on 23 November, in connection with a seminar on information policy at the Ministry of Finances.
